model

Class ControlAF

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ControlAF
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PControlAF

    public class ControlAF
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to model a CAF It is not a classical Argument Framework. We will store the arguments (according to their type) We will store the attacks (according to their type) We need as well a set of arguments to protect

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ControlAF()
      We initialize all data structures

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addArgument(CArgument arg)
      Add an argument
      void addAttack(CAttack att)
      Add an attack
      void addTarget(CArgument arg)
      add an argument to be protected here we first check that it really belong to the fixed argument list
      boolean containsArgument(Argument arg)
      true if arg is an argument of the CAF regardless of its type
      boolean containsAttack(Attack att)
      returns true if the attack att is contained in the CAF regardless of its type returns false else
      java.util.Set<CArgument> getAllArguments()
      returns all arguments of the CAF (regardless of the type) CONTROL FIXED UNCERTAIN
      java.util.Set<Argument> getArgumentAttackers(ArgumentFramework completion, Argument a)
      For a given root completion of the CAF and an argument belonging to the completion (therefore not a control argument) returns all the attackers of that argument (including the control arguments)
      CArgument getArgumentByName(java.lang.String name)
      returns an argument by its name (any kind of argument), null if it cannot be found
      CArgument getArgumentByNameAndType(CArgument.Type type, java.lang.String name)
      returns an argument of a given type by its name, null if it can not be found
      java.util.Set<CArgument> getArgumentsByType(CArgument.Type type)
      returns the set of arguments by type
      java.util.Set<CAttack> getAttacksByType(CAttack.Type type)
      returns the set of attacks by type
      java.util.Set<Argument> getControlAttackers(Argument a, ArgumentFramework completion)
      According to a given completion for a given argument (any type), returns the set of arguments attacking this argument via a control attack if the argument is a control argument, the attackers can be in AC, AU, AF but for AU, argument must belong to completion if the argument is not a control argument, the attackers can only be in AC
      java.util.Set<CArgument> getFreeUncertainArguments(ArgumentFramework af)
      Calculates free uncertain arguments for minimal move purposes as in Definition8 of the report iterate over uncertain attacks and check if it is present in the af.
      java.util.List<Attack> getNonAttacks()
      Builds the list of pairs of arguments that are NOT attacks in the CAF.
      java.util.Set<CArgument> getTarget()
      returns the set of arguments to protect
      boolean isAttack(Attack att, CAttack.Type type)
      returns true if the attack is present with the specified type
      boolean isControlArgument(Argument arg)
      true if arg is a control argument
      boolean isControlAttack(Attack att)
      true if att is a control attack
      boolean isFixedArgument(Argument arg)
      true if arg is a fixed argument
      boolean isFixedAttack(Attack att)
      true if att is a fixed attack
      boolean isHardestRootCompletionCompatible()
      Returns true if no arguments from AU U AF are attacking argumets from AC
      boolean isUncertainArgument(Argument arg)
      true if arg is an uncertain argument
      boolean isUncertainAttack(Attack att)
      true if att is an uncertain attack
      boolean isUndirectedAttack(Attack att)
      true if att is an undirected attack
      void setTarget(java.util.Set<CArgument> target)
      sets the target for the CAF replacing the previous target entirely
      java.lang.String toString()
      String representation of CAF according to apx file format

      • getControlAttackers

        public java.util.Set<Argument> getControlAttackers(Argument a,
                                                   ArgumentFramework completion)
        According to a given completion for a given argument (any type), returns the set of arguments attacking this argument via a control attack if the argument is a control argument, the attackers can be in AC, AU, AF but for AU, argument must belong to completion if the argument is not a control argument, the attackers can only be in AC
        Parameters:
        a -
        Returns:

      • getArgumentAttackers

        public java.util.Set<Argument> getArgumentAttackers(ArgumentFramework completion,
                                                    Argument a)
        For a given root completion of the CAF and an argument belonging to the completion (therefore not a control argument) returns all the attackers of that argument (including the control arguments)
        Parameters:
        completion -
        a -
        Returns:

      • getFreeUncertainArguments

        public java.util.Set<CArgument> getFreeUncertainArguments(ArgumentFramework af)
        Calculates free uncertain arguments for minimal move purposes as in Definition8 of the report iterate over uncertain attacks and check if it is present in the af. If yes, removing From and To from the list of free arguments If no, keeping in the list the list iterate over undirected attacks and check if both sides are present in the af. If yes, removing From and To from the list of free arguments If no, keeping in the list the list
